acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours LC50=0.97mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (EHC78, 2001).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality at doses of >2,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: A rat acute toxicity study (inhalation route) yielded LC50 of >2.9mg/L. However, there are no data available for doses of 2.9mg/L or greater (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related evidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies, whereas tumor incidence was found in rat 30-month carcinogenicity studies, reported In Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978, 1987, 1995). Classification is not possible in the absence of existing classification.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=1.3(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (decomposes at 190degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2771 Thiocarbamate Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004))) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2771 Thiocarbamate Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004))) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests and DNA repair tests) and in vivo mouse genotoxicity tests (host-mediated assay) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1975)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2771 Thiocarbamate Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004))) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and offspring development in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978, 1989)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2771 Thiocarbamate Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004))) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the data from rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)): "Non-irritating to the eye."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1970)): "The substance induced very mild irritation, which persisted by 72 hours."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the data from guinea pig skin sensitization tests using the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1976)): "Sensitization: positive."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 0.922mg/L (25degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description of the human health effects (EHC 78 (1988)): An epidemiological study on workers engaged in zineb manufacturing was carried out and "among workers occupationally exposed to zineb, the following changes were found...chronic bronchitis (4.4%, versus 0.5% in controls)."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including reduced locomotor activity, crouching position, blepharoptosis or eyelid closure, piloerection, and slightly reduced respiration rate (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).
